findings.title: MT - Mints Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to mint tokens. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `mint` function. As a result, the contract tokens will be highly inflated.

findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop transactions for all users excluding the owner by setting `maxTokenAmountPerAddress` to a minimum of 1 or calling the `pause` function.

findings.title: BC - Blacklists Addresses
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop addresses from transactions and may take advantage of it by calling the `blacklistAddress` function.

findings.title: CO - Code Optimization
findings.description: There are code segments that could be optimized to reduce size, memory consumption, and execution time by combining nested if-statements into one using the && operator.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L14 - Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: Using an uninitialized local variable can lead to unpredictable behavior and potentially cause errors in the contract.

findings.title: L17 - Usage of Solidity Assembly
findings.description: Using assembly can be useful for optimizing code, but it can also be error-prone.

findings.title: L18 - Multiple Pragma Directives
findings.description: If the contract includes multiple conflicting pragma directives, it may produce unexpected errors.
findings.contract: Multiple contracts (Helpers.sol, FullFeatureToken.sol, Context.sol, IERC20.sol, IERC20Metadata.sol, ERC20Pausable.sol, ERC20Burnable.sol, ERC20.sol, Pausable.sol, Ownable.sol)
